html: Our goal needs to be to help students know that their degrees are going to be worth their time and money and to help taxpayers know that the federal government isn’t financing programs that do not provide students with a valuable education. #MakingCollegeWorthItpic.twitter.com/Zgd1RUOrlx
text: Our goal needs to be to help students know that their degrees are going to be worth their time and money and to help taxpayers know that the federal government isn’t financing programs that do not provide students with a valuable education. #MakingCollegeWorthItpic.twitter.com/Zgd1RUOrlx

html: And third, we should strengthen the 44 federally recognized accrediting agencies upon which we rely for certifying that students are receiving a quality education.
text: And third, we should strengthen the 44 federally recognized accrediting agencies upon which we rely for certifying that students are receiving a quality education.

html: A second step to improve accountability would be for the federal government to make the data it collects from colleges more useful to students and families.
text: A second step to improve accountability would be for the federal government to make the data it collects from colleges more useful to students and families.

html: For some programs, this new measure should provide colleges with an incentive to lower tuition and help their students stay in school to finish their degrees and find a job so they can repay their loans.
text: For some programs, this new measure should provide colleges with an incentive to lower tuition and help their students stay in school to finish their degrees and find a job so they can repay their loans.

html: Instead, Congress should create a new measure of accountability that looks at whether students are actually repaying their loans.
text: Instead, Congress should create a new measure of accountability that looks at whether students are actually repaying their loans.

html: For the same reasons, Washington should resist the urge to send thousands of federal bureaucrats to evaluate our colleges and universities, which would, in effect, create a national school board for colleges.
text: For the same reasons, Washington should resist the urge to send thousands of federal bureaucrats to evaluate our colleges and universities, which would, in effect, create a national school board for colleges.

html: Four years ago, this Committee passed the Every Student Succeeds Act, which reversed the trend towards a national school board for elementary and secondary education.
text: Four years ago, this Committee passed the Every Student Succeeds Act, which reversed the trend towards a national school board for elementary and secondary education.

html: I do not want the federal government acting as a sort of National School Board for Colleges — telling states and accreditors and boards of directors at institutions how to manage the 6,000 colleges and universities.
text: I do not want the federal government acting as a sort of National School Board for Colleges — telling states and accreditors and boards of directors at institutions how to manage the 6,000 colleges and universities.

html: Today’s hearing will be looking at ways to ensure that students are earning degrees worth their time and money and that taxpayers are paid back the hundreds of billions that they have loaned students to earn degrees.
text: Today’s hearing will be looking at ways to ensure that students are earning degrees worth their time and money and that taxpayers are paid back the hundreds of billions that they have loaned students to earn degrees.

html: Last week, we held a bipartisan hearing about how to create a safe environment for students attending college.
text: Last week, we held a bipartisan hearing about how to create a safe environment for students attending college.

text:
.@POTUS deserves great credit for asking the president of China to control all forms of fentanyl. 

China’s decision to control all forms of fentanyl is the single most important thing that could be done to reduce flow of fentanyl in the U.S.pic.twitter.com/HBEEpN74iq

html: China’s decision to control all forms of fentanyl will save thousands of American lives. html: Some of these the Senate health committee can work on, some of these fall under the jurisdiction of other committees, and some are steps the Administration can take.

html: The recommendations include increasing transparency, lowering prescription drug costs, eliminating surprise billing, expanding primary care, improving electronic health records, and addressing consolidation.
text: The recommendations include increasing transparency, lowering prescription drug costs, eliminating surprise billing, expanding primary care, improving electronic health records, and addressing consolidation.

html: As of the March 1st deadline, we have received over 400 recommendations, some as many as 50 pages long.
text: As of the March 1st deadline, we have received over 400 recommendations, some as many as 50 pages long.

html: Last December, I wrote a letter to @AEI, @BrookingsInst, governors, state insurance commissioners, doctors, patient groups, academic experts, and the public, asking them all to submit specific recommendations to Congress to #LowerHealthCareCosts.

html: I hear about high cost of prescription drugs. I hear from doctors about administrative burden. And, I hear about how the place where medical procedures are performed can make health care more expensive.
text: I hear about high cost of prescription drugs. I hear from doctors about administrative burden. And, I hear about how the place where medical procedures are performed can make health care more expensive.

html: Many people worry about “surprise billing” – which is when a patient receives care at an in-network hospital, but an out-of-network specialist also treats them and sends a separate bill.
text: Many people worry about “surprise billing” – which is when a patient receives care at an in-network hospital, but an out-of-network specialist also treats them and sends a separate bill.

html: .@WarrenBuffett has called the ballooning costs of health care “a hungry tapeworm on the American economy.” Almost every day I hear from Tennesseans concerned that health care is too expensive.
text: .@WarrenBuffett has called the ballooning costs of health care “a hungry tapeworm on the American economy.” Almost every day I hear from Tennesseans concerned that health care is too expensive.

html: It’s important to know that the cost of health care has, in effect, become a tax on the budgets of families, employers, the federal government, and state governments.
text: It’s important to know that the cost of health care has, in effect, become a tax on the budgets of families, employers, the federal government, and state governments.

html: That's why I’m working w/Sens @PattyMurray, @ChuckGrassley & @RonWyden to develop specific bipartisan steps to help deal w/the startling fact that up to 1/2 of what Americans spend on health care services may be unnecessary, according to Dr. Brent James of the National Academies.

html: Because we have a Democrat controlled House, a Republican Senate, and a Republican president, Democrats and Republicans will have to work together to reach a result.

html: And so, my top health care priority this Congress is to pass legislation that will give Americans better health outcomes and better experiences at a lower cost.
text: And so, my top health care priority this Congress is to pass legislation that will give Americans better health outcomes and better experiences at a lower cost.

html: But the truth is the cost of health insurance will not go down, or even increase more slowly, unless we lower the cost of health care.
text: But the truth is the cost of health insurance will not go down, or even increase more slowly, unless we lower the cost of health care.

html: Health insurance has gotten a lot of attention recently – the president tweeted earlier this week, and I agree. High deductibles tied to high premiums make care inaccessible for too many Americans.https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1112711557681762306 …

html: But as Congress seeks to reauthorize the Higher Education Act this year, we should do our best to agree on ways to clarify these three issues.
text: But as Congress seeks to reauthorize the Higher Education Act this year, we should do our best to agree on ways to clarify these three issues.

html: In the future, regulations with the force of law and guidance letters that are merely advisory will continue to interpret federal laws and constitutional requirements governing allegations of sexual assault on campus.
text: In the future, regulations with the force of law and guidance letters that are merely advisory will continue to interpret federal laws and constitutional requirements governing allegations of sexual assault on campus.

html: During this hearing, I would like to focus on three issues raised by the Education Department’s proposed rule: The requirements of due process, including cross examination; the effect of the location of the alleged assault; and the definition of sexual harassment.
text: During this hearing, I would like to focus on three issues raised by the Education Department’s proposed rule: The requirements of due process, including cross examination; the effect of the location of the alleged assault; and the definition of sexual harassment.

html: The purpose of today’s hearing is to hear how we can create more certainty in how colleges and universities should appropriately and fairly respond to allegations of sexual assault.

html: If some Republicans can rise above partisanship on Article I to vote against the declaration of emergency, it is my hope that some of my Democratic friends will agree to do that this week and help us avoid what I've described as a truly miserable choice.
text: If some Republicans can rise above partisanship on Article I to vote against the declaration of emergency, it is my hope that some of my Democratic friends will agree to do that this week and help us avoid what I've described as a truly miserable choice.

html: I know it can be a difficult vote for Democrats, but I earnestly hope that we won't be presented with a truly miserable choice of either continuing to debase the advice and consent role of the Senate or using the Harry Reid precedent to change the Senate rules by majority vote.
text: I know it can be a difficult vote for Democrats, but I earnestly hope that we won't be presented with a truly miserable choice of either continuing to debase the advice and consent role of the Senate or using the Harry Reid precedent to change the Senate rules by majority vote.

html: The proposal offered by Senator @RoyBlunt and @SenatorLankford would not reduce the number of hours we debate Supreme Court justices, cabinet members or certain board nominations.
text: The proposal offered by Senator @RoyBlunt and @SenatorLankford would not reduce the number of hours we debate Supreme Court justices, cabinet members or certain board nominations.

html: I don't think rising above politics ought to be a one-way street. At a time when many complain that the executive has too much power, the U.S. Senate is deliberately weakening itself when we undermine our advice and consent role.
text: I don't think rising above politics ought to be a one-way street. At a time when many complain that the executive has too much power, the U.S. Senate is deliberately weakening itself when we undermine our advice and consent role.

html: The most important and perhaps the best known function of the U.S. Senate is advice and consent to presidential nominations—a crucial part of the checks and balances in our constitutional system that is established to keep one part of our government from having too much power.
text: The most important and perhaps the best known function of the U.S. Senate is advice and consent to presidential nominations—a crucial part of the checks and balances in our constitutional system that is established to keep one part of our government from having too much power.

html: The problem with this is that after a Revolutionary War against a king, our nation’s founders gave to Congress the power to approve all spending so that the president would not have too much power. This check on the executive is a crucial source of our freedom.
text: The problem with this is that after a Revolutionary War against a king, our nation’s founders gave to Congress the power to approve all spending so that the president would not have too much power. This check on the executive is a crucial source of our freedom.

html: Today, the Every Kid Outdoors Act, that U.S. Senator @MartinHeinrich and I introduced, was signed into law by @POTUS. The bill allows 4th graders and their families free entrance to all federal lands and waters, including national parks – more than 2,000 sites in all.
text:
Today, the Every Kid Outdoors Act, that U.S. Senator @MartinHeinrich and I introduced, was signed into law by @POTUS. 

The bill allows 4th graders and their families free entrance to all federal lands and waters, including national parks – more than 2,000 sites in all.

html: It avoids taking money for military construction projects specifically approved by Congress such as military barracks and hospitals. And it also avoids months or years of litigation, which could make it unlikely the full 234 miles are ever built.
text: It avoids taking money for military construction projects specifically approved by Congress such as military barracks and hospitals. And it also avoids months or years of litigation, which could make it unlikely the full 234 miles are ever built.

html: Using authority already approved by Congress avoids the constitutional crisis of separation of powers. It avoids establishing a dangerous precedent, which could be misused by subsequent presidents.
text: Using authority already approved by Congress avoids the constitutional crisis of separation of powers. It avoids establishing a dangerous precedent, which could be misused by subsequent presidents.

html: There is a way the president can avoid this dangerous precedent completely: he can use the congressional funding authority he already has to build the 234 miles of wall that he asked Congress to approve in his January 6 letter to the Senate.
text: There is a way the president can avoid this dangerous precedent completely: he can use the congressional funding authority he already has to build the 234 miles of wall that he asked Congress to approve in his January 6 letter to the Senate.

html: The late Justice Antonin Scalia said, “genius of the American constitutional system is the dispersal of power. Once power is centralized in one person, or one part of government, the Bill of Rights is just words of paper.”
text: The late Justice Antonin Scalia said, “genius of the American constitutional system is the dispersal of power. Once power is centralized in one person, or one part of government, the Bill of Rights is just words of paper.”

html: Separation of those powers is a crucial constitutional imperative that goes to the heart of our freedom.
text: Separation of those powers is a crucial constitutional imperative that goes to the heart of our freedom.

html: The Constitution gave that responsibility exclusively to a Congress elected by the people, and every one of us United States senators has sworn an oath to support that Constitution.
text: The Constitution gave that responsibility exclusively to a Congress elected by the people, and every one of us United States senators has sworn an oath to support that Constitution.

html: After an American revolution against a king, our founders chose not to create a chief executive who could tax the people and spend their money any way he chose.
text: After an American revolution against a king, our founders chose not to create a chief executive who could tax the people and spend their money any way he chose.

html: There is no limit to the imagination of what the next leftwing president could do to harm our country with this precedent.
text: There is no limit to the imagination of what the next leftwing president could do to harm our country with this precedent.

html: If President Trump can build a wall when Congress has refused to provide the funding, then the next president can declare a national emergency and tear the wall down or declare a climate change emergency and stop oil exports and offshore drilling.
text: If President Trump can build a wall when Congress has refused to provide the funding, then the next president can declare a national emergency and tear the wall down or declare a climate change emergency and stop oil exports and offshore drilling.

html: There has never been an instance where a president has asked for funding, Congress refused it, and the president then used the National Emergencies Act to justify spending the money anyway.
text: There has never been an instance where a president has asked for funding, Congress refused it, and the president then used the National Emergencies Act to justify spending the money anyway.

html: The Democrat minority is determined to make it nearly impossible for @POTUS to form a government, to fill the 1,200 federal government positions that require confirmation by the U.S. Senate as part of our constitutional responsibility to advise and consent to nominations.
text: The Democrat minority is determined to make it nearly impossible for @POTUS to form a government, to fill the 1,200 federal government positions that require confirmation by the U.S. Senate as part of our constitutional responsibility to advise and consent to nominations.

html: This is a problem not just for our Committee’s nominees—it is a problem for the entire Senate.
text: This is a problem not just for our Committee’s nominees—it is a problem for the entire Senate.

html: This meant these well-qualified nominees never received their confirmation, and had to be sent back to the president to be re-nominated at the start of the new Congress. Five of these nominees have been waiting over a year for their confirmations.
text: This meant these well-qualified nominees never received their confirmation, and had to be sent back to the president to be re-nominated at the start of the new Congress. Five of these nominees have been waiting over a year for their confirmations.

html: This legislation is a significant down payment on border security and a response to a major national problem. I congratulate @SenShelby, @SenatorLeahy and the committee for producing this result, and I hope the president signs it.
text: This legislation is a significant down payment on border security and a response to a major national problem. I congratulate @SenShelby, @SenatorLeahy and the committee for producing this result, and I hope the president signs it.

html: There are also funds to secure the ports of entry, through which so much of drug traffic travels.
text: There are also funds to secure the ports of entry, through which so much of drug traffic travels.

html: In this bill, Congress responds with $22 billion for border security, which includes 55 new miles of physical barrier or wall on the southern border, an increase of 5,000 detention beds, and funding for technology and more border agents.
text: In this bill, Congress responds with $22 billion for border security, which includes 55 new miles of physical barrier or wall on the southern border, an increase of 5,000 detention beds, and funding for technology and more border agents.

html: Second, we included provisions to encourage new pain management strategies, such as physical therapy. Third, the new law requires experts to study chronic pain and report to the Director of the @NIH how patients can better manage their pain.
text: Second, we included provisions to encourage new pain management strategies, such as physical therapy. Third, the new law requires experts to study chronic pain and report to the Director of the @NIH how patients can better manage their pain.

html: First – We gave the @NIH more flexibility and authority to spur research and development of new non-addictive painkillers. We have backed up those new authorities with substantial funding – most recently $500 million to help the NIH find a new non-addictive painkiller.
text: First – We gave the @NIH more flexibility and authority to spur research and development of new non-addictive painkillers. We have backed up those new authorities with substantial funding – most recently $500 million to help the NIH find a new non-addictive painkiller.

html: We also took steps to ensure our new law wouldn’t make life harder for patients with pain, but now we need to take the next step to try to find new ways to help them.
text: We also took steps to ensure our new law wouldn’t make life harder for patients with pain, but now we need to take the next step to try to find new ways to help them.

html: Last year, Congress passed comprehensive opioid legislation to combat this crisis, which @POTUS called “the single largest bill to combat a drug crisis in the history of our country.”
text: Last year, Congress passed comprehensive opioid legislation to combat this crisis, which @POTUS called “the single largest bill to combat a drug crisis in the history of our country.”

html: More than 70,000 Americans died from drug overdoses last year, including prescription opioids, making it the biggest public health crisis in our country.
text: More than 70,000 Americans died from drug overdoses last year, including prescription opioids, making it the biggest public health crisis in our country.

html: These Americans need more effective ways than opioids or other addictive painkillers to manage pain. Opioids, which are commonly used to treat pain, can lead to addiction and overdose.
text: These Americans need more effective ways than opioids or other addictive painkillers to manage pain. Opioids, which are commonly used to treat pain, can lead to addiction and overdose.

html: We are holding this hearing to better understand the causes of pain, how we can improve care for patients with pain, and where we are on developing new medicines and ways to treat pain.
text: We are holding this hearing to better understand the causes of pain, how we can improve care for patients with pain, and where we are on developing new medicines and ways to treat pain.

html: But on the theory that every action has an unintended consequence, we want to make sure that as we deal with the opioid crisis, we keep in mind those people that are hurting.
text: But on the theory that every action has an unintended consequence, we want to make sure that as we deal with the opioid crisis, we keep in mind those people that are hurting.

html: Here is the reality: we are engaged in a massive effort to make dramatic reductions in the supply and use of opioids – the most effective painkiller we have.
text: Here is the reality: we are engaged in a massive effort to make dramatic reductions in the supply and use of opioids – the most effective painkiller we have.

html: A new report released in 2018, from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, says that about 50 million Americans have chronic pain, and nearly 20 million of those Americans have high-impact chronic pain.
text: A new report released in 2018, from the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention, says that about 50 million Americans have chronic pain, and nearly 20 million of those Americans have high-impact chronic pain.

html: Dan’s wife is one out of 100 million Americans who, according to a 2011 report by what was then the Institute of Medicine, now the National Academy of Medicine, are living with some pain—that is about 30 percent of Americans. 25 million of those have moderate or severe pain.
text: Dan’s wife is one out of 100 million Americans who, according to a 2011 report by what was then the Institute of Medicine, now the National Academy of Medicine, are living with some pain—that is about 30 percent of Americans. 25 million of those have moderate or severe pain.

html: Dan wrote, “She is not an abuser, and is doing everything right. Now it’s harder for her to get the medicine she needs.”
text: Dan wrote, “She is not an abuser, and is doing everything right. Now it’s harder for her to get the medicine she needs.”

html: Dan, a constituent of mine who lives in Maryville, recently wrote me on @facebook about his wife, who has a rare disease that causes her chronic pain. Dan is concerned because it has become more difficult for her to access painkillers.

html: There are other ways to lower health care costs through expanded access to primary care. Another is community health centers, which we talked about at our last hearing and that are where 27 million Americans go for their primary care.

html: I believe we can empower primary care doctors, nurse practitioners, and physicians assistants to go even a step further. At our 4th hearing, we heard about how patients have no idea how much a particular treatment or test will end up costing.

html: Dr. Adam Boehler, who leads the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation, recently told me that primary care is only 3-7 percent of health care spending, but affects as much as half of all health care spending.
text: Dr. Adam Boehler, who leads the Center for Medicare and Medicaid Innovation, recently told me that primary care is only 3-7 percent of health care spending, but affects as much as half of all health care spending.

html: Dr. Gross’ practice is one of about a thousand similar clinics in the United States and is a good example of how a primary care doctor can help reduce costs.

html: In 2010, Dr. Gross created one of the first Direct Primary Care practices. Instead of working with insurance companies and government programs, Dr. Gross’ patients pay him a flat monthly fee directly.
text: In 2010, Dr. Gross created one of the first Direct Primary Care practices. Instead of working with insurance companies and government programs, Dr. Gross’ patients pay him a flat monthly fee directly.

html: It is our responsibility to take whatever steps we can to help students afford college and make sure that the degrees they earn are worth the time and money they pay for them. #MakingCollegeWorthItpic.twitter.com/vwhLbGluFE
text: It is our responsibility to take whatever steps we can to help students afford college and make sure that the degrees they earn are worth the time and money they pay for them. #MakingCollegeWorthItpic.twitter.com/vwhLbGluFE

html: In my conversations with Democrat and Republican senators, I have found a remarkable degree of bipartisan consensus about the directions we should take to make college affordable and make students’ degrees worth their time and money.
text: In my conversations with Democrat and Republican senators, I have found a remarkable degree of bipartisan consensus about the directions we should take to make college affordable and make students’ degrees worth their time and money.

html: This year, I have met with Ranking Democrat Senator @PattyMurray and nine other committee members to discuss compiling these ideas into a single piece of legislation.
text: This year, I have met with Ranking Democrat Senator @PattyMurray and nine other committee members to discuss compiling these ideas into a single piece of legislation.

html: During the last four years, the Senate education committee has held 27 hearings on the Higher Education Act. These hearings have resulted in a number of bipartisan proposals that make college more affordable and worth students’ time and money.
text: During the last four years, the Senate education committee has held 27 hearings on the Higher Education Act.  These hearings have resulted in a number of bipartisan proposals that make college more affordable and worth students’ time and money.

html: Third, I am proposing a new accountability system based upon whether borrowers are actually repaying their student loans. This should lower tuition for some programs, or even discourage schools from offering programs that are not worth it to students.
text: Third, I am proposing a new accountability system based upon whether borrowers are actually repaying their student loans. This should lower tuition for some programs, or even discourage schools from offering programs that are not worth it to students.

html: This plan makes sure if there was no money earned, there would be no money owed, and that would not reflect negatively on a borrower’s credit. The other option would be a 10-year payment plan, with equal monthly payments, similar to a 10-year mortgage.
text: This plan makes sure if there was no money earned, there would be no money owed, and that would not reflect negatively on a borrower’s credit. The other option would be a 10-year payment plan, with equal monthly payments, similar to a 10-year mortgage.

html: The option I believe most borrowers would choose is a repayment plan based on a borrower’s income, which would never require the borrower to make payments of more than ten percent of his or her discretionary income.
text: The option I believe most borrowers would choose is a repayment plan based on a borrower’s income, which would never require the borrower to make payments of more than ten percent of his or her discretionary income.

html: Second, a new way to repay student loans: We should scrap the current system of nine different ways to repay federal student loans. It should be replaced with two options, both of which would automatically deduct payments from your paycheck.
text: Second, a new way to repay student loans: We should scrap the current system of nine different ways to repay federal student loans. It should be replaced with two options, both of which would automatically deduct payments from your paycheck.

html: First, simplify the #FAFSA: We can cut the dreaded Free Application for Federal Student Aid from 108 questions to no more than two dozen.
text: First, simplify the #FAFSA: We can cut the dreaded Free Application for Federal Student Aid from 108 questions to no more than two dozen.

html: Today, I have three proposals to help make the answer to all four of those questions YES.
text: Today, I have three proposals to help make the answer to all four of those questions YES.

html: And from administrators as well—can’t you do something about the jungle of red tape that makes it so hard to apply for federal financial aid, to pay back student loans and that wastes money on overhead that could instead be spent on students?
text: And from administrators as well—can’t you do something about the jungle of red tape that makes it so hard to apply for federal financial aid, to pay back student loans and that wastes money on overhead that could instead be spent on students?

html: The questions I hear most often about college are: Can I afford it? Is it worth it? And can you make applying for financial aid and repaying student loans simpler?
text: The questions I hear most often about college are: Can I afford it? Is it worth it? And can you make applying for financial aid and repaying student loans simpler?

html: The U.S. has most of the best colleges in the world, but also the most graduates paying off college debt. Roughly 40 million borrowers owe $1.5 trillion in collective student loan debt.
text: The U.S. has most of the best colleges in the world, but also the most graduates paying off college debt. Roughly 40 million borrowers owe $1.5 trillion in collective student loan debt.

html: A college graduate paying more than $1000 per month on student loans recently wrote, “I was told to chase down a bachelor’s degree by any means necessary. But no one mentions just how expensive and soul-crushing the debt will be.”

html: In Fiscal Year 2019, these centers received $4 billion in mandatory funding and $1.6 billion in discretionary funding. Congress has to act by the end of September to make sure community health centers continue to receive this federal funding and keep their doors open.
text: In Fiscal Year 2019, these centers received $4 billion in mandatory funding and $1.6 billion in discretionary funding. Congress has to act by the end of September to make sure community health centers continue to receive this federal funding and keep their doors open.

html: Because the Lewis Health Center @MauryRegional is a community health center, they charge patients based on a sliding scale which means more people have access to and can afford health care close to home.
text: Because the Lewis Health Center @MauryRegional is a community health center, they charge patients based on a sliding scale which means more people have access to and can afford health care close to home.

html: The old hospital building was turned into the Lewis Health Center @MauryRegional, a community health center which operates as something between a clinic and full hospital. Lewis Health Center estimates they can deal with about 90 percent of patients that walk in the door.

html: Community health centers actually fit into a larger topic of great interest to this committee – primary care. Today, we are talking about the community health centers where 27 million Americans receive their primary care and other services.
text: Community health centers actually fit into a larger topic of great interest to this committee – primary care. Today, we are talking about the community health centers where 27 million Americans receive their primary care and other services.

html: Today’s topic is extending federal funding for community health centers, as well as four other federal health programs, which are all set to expire at the end of September.
text: Today’s topic is extending federal funding for community health centers, as well as four other federal health programs, which are all set to expire at the end of September.

html: 3.Go really big: Begin the new Congress by creating a legal immigration system that secures our borders and defines legal status for those already here...
text: 3.Go really big: Begin the new Congress by creating a legal immigration system that secures our borders and defines legal status for those already here...

html: 2.Go bigger: Pass the bill that 54 sens—including 46 Ds—voted for last Feb that combined a solution for children brought to the U.S. illegally (DACA) & $25B in appropriated funding for border security over 10yrs. The bill failed only because of last-minute White House opposition.
text: 2.Go bigger: Pass the bill that 54 sens—including 46 Ds—voted for last Feb that combined a solution for children brought to the U.S. illegally (DACA) & $25B in appropriated funding for border security over 10yrs. The bill failed only because of last-minute White House opposition.

html: 1.Go small: Give the president the $1.6B he asked for in this year’s budget request, which the bipartisan Senate Appropriations Committee approved. Provide an additional $1B to improve border security at ports of entry, which everyone concedes is needed.
text: 1.Go small: Give the president the $1.6B he asked for in this year’s budget request, which the bipartisan Senate Appropriations Committee approved. Provide an additional $1B to improve border security at ports of entry, which everyone concedes is needed.

html: This shutdown is a failure by negotiators, both Democrat and Republican, and will produce a success for no one.
text: This shutdown is a failure by negotiators, both Democrat and Republican, and will produce a success for no one.

html: This shutdown wastes taxpayer dollars, adds uncertainty to the economy and hurts small businesses around our national parks. A government shutdown should be as off limits in budget negotiations as chemical weapons are in warfare.
text: This shutdown wastes taxpayer dollars, adds uncertainty to the economy and hurts small businesses around our national parks. A government shutdown should be as off limits in budget negotiations as chemical weapons are in warfare.

html: When the government shut down under President Obama, I said that I was elected to make the government work for taxpayers, not to shut it down. The same is true under President Trump.
text: When the government shut down under President Obama, I said that I was elected to make the government work for taxpayers, not to shut it down. The same is true under President Trump.

html: I want to make sure Tennesseans know, as I have said from its beginning, that I believe there is no excuse whatsoever for this partial government shutdown.
text: I want to make sure Tennesseans know, as I have said from its beginning, that I believe there is no excuse whatsoever for this partial government shutdown.

html: I hope everyone has a Merry Christmas and a happy New Year!pic.twitter.com/xBbEF8E9em
text: I hope everyone has a Merry Christmas and a happy New Year!pic.twitter.com/xBbEF8E9em

html: I was not elected to shut down the government, I was elected to make it work for taxpayers. This is a complete failure of negotiations and a success for no one.
text: I was not elected to shut down the government, I was elected to make it work for taxpayers. This is a complete failure of negotiations and a success for no one.

html: Shutting down the government should be as off limits to budget negotiations as chemical weapons are to warfare. I was not for a government shutdown under President Obama. I'm not for a government shutdown under President Trump.
text: Shutting down the government should be as off limits to budget negotiations as chemical weapons are to warfare. I was not for a government shutdown under President Obama. I'm not for a government shutdown under President Trump.

html: There is no excuse for even a short-term, partial government shutdown.
text: There is no excuse for even a short-term, partial government shutdown.

html: I want to put a stop to this practice of the Senate breaking its rules to change its rules. I will not vote to turn the Senate into a rule-breaking institution, and I hope that my colleagues will not either.
text: I want to put a stop to this practice of the Senate breaking its rules to change its rules. I will not vote to turn the Senate into a rule-breaking institution, and I hope that my colleagues will not either.

html: This is a country that prizes the rule of law – I’ve heard President Trump say that, and I've heard President Obama say that. How can we expect Americans to follow the rules when their number one rule making institution, the U.S. Senate, will not follow its own rules?
text: This is a country that prizes the rule of law – I’ve heard President Trump say that, and I've heard President Obama say that. How can we expect Americans to follow the rules when their number one rule making institution, the U.S. Senate, will not follow its own rules?

html: Ending the legislative filibuster would be like allowing the home team to change the rules in the middle of the game, saying a nine yard gain is a first down, or a three point shot counts as four. That's not the rule of law.
text: Ending the legislative filibuster would be like allowing the home team to change the rules in the middle of the game, saying a nine yard gain is a first down, or a three point shot counts as four.  That's not the rule of law.

html: This is 2 milligrams of fentanyl—a lethal dose in most people. On Saturday, China announced it will control all forms of fentanyl as a way of stopping the flow of this dangerous synthetic opioid into the U.S. both by mail and by smuggling through Mexico and Canada.pic.twitter.com/o0PSkr9gXB
text:
This is 2 milligrams of fentanyl—a lethal dose in most people. 

On Saturday, China announced it will control all forms of fentanyl as a way of stopping the flow of this dangerous synthetic opioid into the U.S. both by mail and by smuggling through Mexico and Canada.pic.twitter.com/o0PSkr9gXB

text: Pausing to reflect upon how President Bush lived his life is a wonderful lesson for all of us about how to try to live our own lives.

html: Presidents Trump, Obama, George W. Bush, Clinton and Carter were there. The tributes were eloquent and moving, especially George W.’s.

html: Honey and I just returned from President @GeorgeHWBush’s memorial service. It truly was a celebration of a remarkable life and of the life of our country. #Remembering41
